items.name: Lulla
items.desc:
A super sessionable 3.5% pale nomadically brewed at Burning Sky using London Fog yeast, oats, wheat and tonnes of Citra and Simcoe for flavours of yellow starburst; black pepper; dandelion; salted lime; pine sap and lemon pith.
We’re offering free nationwide shipping for orders over £50 and free local deliveries for orders over £30 (both for arrival next week), plus a Click + Collect service from our brewery door this Saturday (27th; midday - 6pm) - we’d love to see you.

items.name: Parade
items.desc:
The latest iteration of The Beak’s mercurial house IPA was nomadically brewed with our friends at Burning Sky with London Fog yeast and three of our favourite hop varieties, Citra, Mosaic and Idaho 7, resulting in fruit bubblegum flavours of mango, orange peel, pineapple and ripe flat peaches. Take part in our pre-sale and receive these perks!
*This is a pre-sale product and will be delivered as soon as it is packaged, which we expect to be week commencing 8 June. For full shipping details, please click here.

items.name: Avatar State
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
Welcome to the Neon Sky level.
Amarillo | Simcoe | Chinook | Centennial

items.name: Best Bitter with Mills Brewing
items.desc: Our collaboration with Mills! Fruit flavours from the yeast, toffee and honey sweetness, balance with large amounts of Goldings hops.

items.name: Dark Mild
items.desc: A dark, low strength, rich and flavourful ale. Chocolate and caramel malts, with a dash of English hops giving spice and dried fruit.

items.name: Dreamful
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
Do you remember the dream before you were born?
Were we more awake then or now?
Anyway... here's a lovely IPA. Enjoy x

items.name: Emerald Sky
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
What a fresh feeling, seeing a glittering sky of emeralds and diamonds, so far up above the forest.
This beer is pale and it's most certainly an ale. Wow, what more is there to say?

items.name: Golden Ale
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
One more step along the golden path; windswept memories of garden beers.
Golden Promise barley with Goldings and Pilgrim hops.

items.name: Native Place
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
A delicate, sherbetty blend of fruity hops sitting on top of a soft and creamy base. Smooth, saturated and delicious.

items.name: Oh Ginkgo
items.desc:
Save 10% when you buy 12 ! (Mix & Match)
Ginkgo biloba, also known as the maidenhair tree, was eaten by dinosaurs the size of buildings. It has no known living relatives, having survived millions of years alone. It is a symbol of hope and peace.
Also, it looks cool on a beer can

items.name: Table Beer
items.desc:
A beer for the dinner table, or a picnic in the park - or whenever really - but a lower alcohol content shouldn't mean lack of flavour.
Fluffy malts, fruity yeast and a good dose of modern, intense hops.

items.name: A Rising Tide Nelson & Motueka IPA
items.desc:
There's something special about New Zealand hops - Nelson Sauvin in particular is famed for its distinctive sauvignon blanc wine aroma. But never mind all that - this here is a healthy 6.5% IPA that is smooth, punchy and really downright delicious.
I know we would say that, but there you go.
This beer was named in an eternally optimistic moment. A hope for community, for togetherness, for a better future. A rising tide lifts all boats, so the saying goes. The tide is stretching out now, let's hope we can all bob in safely on the next tide.

items.name: All Together IPA
items.desc:
This is a West Coast style IPA, punchy and bright. It's part of a worldwide collaboration with Other Half Brewing with the aim of supporting hospitality workers who have been affected by the Covid-19 pandemic. Read more here!
Canopy will donate £1 from each can that we sell retail, or £5 from each case sold to trade to the Licensed Trade Charity to support bar, pub and brewery workers. The Licensed Trade Charity offers practical, emotional and financial help to those working in the licensed trade, and we're pleased to be able to support the work that they are doing.
This beer helps us, you get a beer out of it, and it helps workers in an industry that is facing some uncertain times.
You're going to feel great drinking this beer.

items.name: Brockwell IPA
items.desc:
Like its namesake, the park next to our brewery, our Brockwell IPA is a beer to enjoy in the sunshine relaxing with friends. Grab a football, a frisbee, maybe even a barbecue, this is a beer for those long lazy days that you never want to end.
It’s juicy, tropical and completely crushable, and those citra hops hide that 5.6% abv pretty well. Go on, you earned it.
Suitable for vegans

items.name: Champion Kölsch
items.desc:
This is our take on a Kölsch, a classic beer style from Cologne, Germany. Cold-fermented and long-matured this lager is crisp, dry and very refreshing. Best served ice cold, and best enjoyed after a match, a race, or a run ‘round the park.
Keep a few cans in the fridge ready to celebrate your next sporting achievement, however big or small.
Suitable for vegans.

items.name: Llopper Everyday Oyster Stout
items.desc:
Made in collaboration with The Oystermen who bring us their choice of Maldon oysters for this beer, the beer is rich and dry, with notes of minerality and saline from the oysters.
www.oystermen.co.uk
Contains oysters!

items.name: Paceline Lime & Salt Lager
items.desc: Think margaritas at the poolside. Think lager and lime with a packet of peanuts in a pub garden. That's what we've brought for you here. Refreshingly down to earth.

items.name: Snapper Session IPA
items.desc:
Crack the code and crack a smile: say hello to Snapper! Snapper is the little brother to our NEIPA Snap and joins our core range in 330ml can. Spritzy, light and fruity, this hazy IPA is a happy little addition to our line up.
Suitable for vegans.

items.name: Sunray Pale Ale
items.desc:
This is the beer to reward yourself with after a hard day grafting or crafting. A real easy-drinking pale ale dry-hopped with Chinook, at a perfectly sessionable 4.2% abv.
A beer for all occasions, not just when the sun is shining.
Suitable for vegans.

items.name: A Gentle Nod To Welcome Visitors
items.desc:
This is our garden,
both of us just visiting.
Buds, and fresh new growth.
9.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Smooth orange juice and pulped mango, leading to sticky marmalade with some honey notes coming through
Body: Seriously full-bodied and sweet with a thick, fruit juice character
Aftertaste: Lingering flavour of marmalade without the zest, backed up by peppery notes and a dank hop character
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: All Together IPA
items.desc:
This is our own version of the worldwide collaboration hosted by Other Half, Stout Collective and Craftpeak to support the hospitality industry during the COVID-19 pandemic.
It's a juicy IPA brewed with Citra, Mosaic, Simcoe and Cascade, with 100% of profits from its sale being donated to organisations supporting hospitality workers.
Keep an eye out for versions from over 500 breweries worldwide all working to help others in need. Visit alltogether.beer for all the details and a list of breweries involved.
6.0% ABV 440ml
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Are You The Brewer?
items.desc:
This is just another can of IPA. It’s also the result of hundreds of people toiling in the fields, driving hops along straight country roads, and working long shifts for the benefit of those they’ll never meet. To the many under-represented and under-celebrated, skilled field, factory and back-of-house workers, this one’s for the 99% of the industry that aren’t brewers, but are just as important. Thanks, and cheers!
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Back On Boogie St
items.desc:
In the early 70s, while Chuck Zimmerman was in heated discussions over the rights to Columbus, or Tomahawk (to use its trademark name), another Zimmerman by the name of Tucker released Ten Songs. Years later, in the early 2000s, by which time Columbus had firmly established itself as a favourite hop used to add backbone and bitterness to APAs and Pale Ales, Ten New Songs, a masterful album by Leonard Cohen was released.Columbus isn’t new, and may no longer occupy a prime position, but like those classic records of days gone, that don’t make it junk.
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Bird Tweets Trump Trump Tweets
items.desc:
Crop Year 2019 DDH Pale hopped with Chinook, Idaho 7, Citra & Columbus.
5.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Crop Year 2019 4 Pack
items.desc:
This four-pack is a joyous celebration of some of our favourite, hand selected Crop Year 2019 hops.
We've poured a significant amount of our passion, expertise and time into selecting hops that will excite, delight and occasionally surprise you. It makes us proud to be able to share them with you in this way.
These latest releases from our Crop Year 2019 series represent a departure from their predecessors. Rather than focusing on a single hop, they showcase blends of some varietals from the most recent crop, tailored to suit a quartet of different styles.
We'll also be hosting a live stream to accompany this pack next Thursday (July 2nd), so you'll receive an email after purchase giving you details on how to join. Our founder Paul Jones will talk through the four beers and the hop selection process, giving you insight into the process and answering any burning questions you may have.
This pack includes the following four beers:
1 x Our Highs, Their Lows 5% - Crop Year 2019 Pilsner hopped with hand-selected Centennial, Loral & Columbus (440ml can)
1 x Land Of Landings, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Double Dry Hopped IPA, hopped with hand-selected Simcoe, Mosaic, El Dorado & Columbus (440ml can)
1 x Friends In Small Places, 8% - Crop Year 2019 Double IPA, hopped with hand-selected Citra, Amarillo & Sabro (440ml can)
1 x Bird Tweets Trump Trump Tweets, 5% - Crop Year 2019 Double Dry Hopped Pale, hopped with hand-selected Chinook, Idaho 7, Citra & Columbus  (440ml can)
**THIS PACK IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR DISCOUNTS AS IT'S ALREADY DISCOUNTED**

items.name: Friends In Small Spaces
items.desc:
Crop Year 2019 DIPA hopped with Citra, Amarillo & Sabro.
8.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Just The Right Shape
items.desc:
For many people, the past few months have shattered norms, leaving only fragments of our previous lives.With some patience and with something beautiful in mind we can align these fragments into something delightful.
With time and a small change in perspective, there aren’t just broken pieces in front of us, but also building blocks. In time, just the right shape will reveal itself.
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: La Deuxième Saison Des Poires
items.desc:
Brewed with our friends from After The Harvest and Oliver's, this beer-perry hybrid is crisp, vibrant and thirst-quenching, finding harmony between classic perry flavours, yeast aromatics and hop notes. It was created by blending beer wort with pear juice and fermenting with a Saison yeast, before ageing in foudre for 10 months. A light Simcoe dry hop was then added prior to bottling.
ALC 5.4% VOL 750ML
Aroma & Flavour: Sweet pineapple and fresh green pear, accompanied by light lemony sourness and underpinned by light cereal malt character
Body: Light-bodied, crisp and dry with prickly carbonation
Aftertaste: Spice and doughy white bread mingle with pine and herbal hop notes
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Land Of Landings
items.desc:
Crop Year 2019 DDH IPA hopped with Simcoe, Mosaic, El Dorado & Columbus.
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: My Poems Are Not Poems
items.desc:
A blended foudre beer
This beer is a blend of two foudre beers, one flavoured by an extended steeping of chuckleberries, and the other by macerating freshly-harvested plums for three months. This combination adds a breadth of flavour, without adding weight.
Light and fresh, best paired with becoming still enough that birds and flying insects are not disturbed by your presence.
ALC 5.6% VOL 750ML
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Only A Dream Can Kill A Dream
items.summary: Fresh, Funky Barrel-fermented Pale with Tropical Fruits
items.desc:
Fresh, Funky Pale Ale full of tropical fruit salad flavours.
Racked onto the remaining lees in first-use French natural red wine barrels, this Pale first developed delicate funky notes and a refreshing, dry finish. Refermentation on passion fruit, pineapple and mango created a succulent, yet zippy, tropical punch bowl of flavours. Waking up from 400 years of slumber, we can summon the energy of a great man, that had a great dream. Best served chilled, and following a period of service to others less privileged.
ALC 5.9% VOL 750ML
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Our Highs, Their Lows
items.desc:
Crop Year 2019 Pilsner hopped with Centennial, Loral and Columbus.
5.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Ponderosa Pines On Rainier
items.desc:
Released in the early 70s, Cascade hops, named after the California to British Columbia mountain range, became a staple in new US beer styles, such as the American Pale Ale. Often overlooked by modern breweries, it’s a hop that once was, and still is, revered for its grapefruit and pine aromas. Take it on as you would a short history lesson, and though its modern setting in this beer is far removed from the original beers it took centre stage in, enjoy it as a looking-glass back into the pioneering trailblazers that came before us.
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Singel Hopped IPA
items.desc:
One of the newest hops on our contracts, Strata delivers a unique aroma combination that wouldn’t be out of place at a tropical fruit juice bar in Amsterdam. It’ll add depth and character in the mix with other hops, but it stands proud in this single-hopped IPA. Take a moment to inhale properly, and alter your experience one sip at a time.
6.0% ABV 440ml
Aroma & Flavour: Gently swirl the glass and inhale both quickly and deeply through your nose. Take several mouthfuls, swirl in your mouth, taste and experience the smell upon exhalation
Body: Evaluate the texture of the beer in the mouth, the thickness, carbonation, and smoothness as you swallow
Aftertaste: Note lingering flavours and sensations in the mouth after drinking
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Special Release Selection 8 Pack
items.desc:
Get a proper flavour of Cloudwater with this selection pack showcasing some of our special release beers.
All of our special release beers are designed to provide a slightly different representation of our house style and our wider approach to brewing. We experiment with processes, some of which provide light bulb moments for us and improve future beers across the board!
They provide a wide range of flavours and experiences, bringing together our wealth of brewing and drinking experience and a respect for classic styles with a thoroughly modern, flavour-first approach.
This pack includes the following eight beers:
1 x Are You The Brewer?, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Ekuanot single-hopped IPA (440ml can)
1 x Ponderosa Pines On Rainier, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Cascade single-hopped IPA (440ml can)
1 x Just The Right Shape, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Mosaic single-hopped IPA (440ml can)
1 x Back On Boogie St, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Columbus single-hopped IPA (440ml can)
1 x Singel Hopped IPA, 6% - Crop Year 2019 Strata single-hopped IPA (440ml can)
1 x All Together IPA, 6% - This is own version of the worldwide collaboration hosted by Other Half, Stout Collective and Craftpeak to support the hospitality industry during the COVID-19 pandemic. It's a juicy IPA brewed with Citra, Mosaic, Simcoe and Cascade, with 100% of profits from its sale being donated to organisations supporting hospitality workers.(440ml can)
1 x Edge Of The Bread, 6% - A double dry-hopped IPA, with Citra, Idaho 7 & Galaxy (440ml can)
1 x A Gentle Nod To Welcome Visitors, 9% - A modern, heavily hopped Barley Wine (440ml can)
**THIS PACK IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR DISCOUNTS AS IT'S ALREADY DISCOUNTED**

items.name: Speyside Persistence Is Utile
items.summary: Speyside BA Stout w/ Coffee & Vanilla
items.desc:
Speyside Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout conditioned on vanilla beans and single-origin Peruvian coffee beans from Workshop Coffee.
The base beer in this bottle was brewed in days we considered normal. We're releasing this beer now in difficult times, but our intentions, and our care for your experience haven't changed.
We hope you will find the time for yourself to enjoy this infusion of a rich base beer with both fine coffee and Speyside whisky, and to relax into the sense that everything is going to be OK.
10% ABV 375ml Bottle
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: The Edge Of The Bread
items.desc:
DDH IPA w/ Citra, Idaho 7 and Galaxy
6.0% ABV 440ml
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: The Light Grey One
items.desc:
Nelson & Citra DIPA.
Both legs together,
The click, click of sixteen nails.
Warm pads on cold stone.
8% ABV 440ml
ALLERGENS: GLUTEN WHEAT BARLEY OATS

items.name: Barrel Aged Grand Stout
items.desc:
A grand and rich imperial Stout brewed to celebrate our 1000th brew, aged in Auchentoshan whiskey barrels for 11 months.
Flavours of tobacco, roasted coffee, honey, toffee and caramel, with a little spice, oak, and sweet vanilla.

items.name: Five Points Best
items.desc: Five Points Best is a single-hopped Best Bitter, brewed with Fuggles hops from Hukins Hops. Refreshing and smooth, Best has notes of caramel and biscuit, and a lovely grassy, herbal freshness that makes you want to reach for another one

items.name: Five Points Jupa
items.desc:
JUPA is a 5.5% juicy, fruity Pale Ale and the newest addition to our core range.
Hopped with Simcoe in the boil and dry-hopped with Citra and Mosaic, JUPA has bold, juicy citrus flavours and a tropical fruit character bursting with pineapple, mango and papaya. It was brewed with a touch of wheat and oats for a silky malt backbone, allowing the West Coast hops to shine.
JUPA’s low bitterness differentiates it from our Pale Ale and XPA and makes it a real thirst-quencher that’s juicy and totally crushable.

items.name: Five Points Micro Pale
items.desc:
Introducing our new lower-strength Pale Ale. At just 2.8% it's micro in strength but mighty in flavour.
Packed with Cascade and Vic Secret Hops, it's bursting with aromas of grapefruit, citrus and pine. It might just be the perfect WFH beer.

items.name: Five Points Pale
items.desc:
NEW! EXPERIENCE DRAUGHT PALE AT HOME!
Our Five Points Pale is a fresh, zesty, aromatic pale ale brewed with malted barley, a little wheat, and Amarillo and Citra hops from the West Coast of the USA. It’s our flagship beer, and its citrus, resinous notes make it a perfect easy-drinking beer for any occasion.
The first beer we ever brewed, our Pale proudly represents both the British ale tradition and the worldwide craft beer movement, resulting in an incredibly drinkable beer with tonnes of flavour.

items.name: Five Points Pale
items.desc:
Our Five Points Pale is a fresh, zesty, aromatic pale ale brewed with malted barley, a little wheat, and Amarillo and Citra hops from the West Coast of the USA. It’s our flagship beer, and its citrus, resinous notes make it a perfect easy-drinking beer for any occasion.
The first beer we ever brewed, our Pale proudly represents both the British ale tradition and the worldwide craft beer movement, resulting in an incredibly drinkable beer with tonnes of flavour.

items.name: Five Points Pils
items.desc:
A crisp and refreshing unfiltered Pilsner lager, brewed and dry-hopped with traditional Noble hops. Our Pils is a distinct, modern version of this classic lager style.
We spent 9 months working on and developing a recipe and brew we were happy with. There’s a bready sweetness, with lightly toasted biscuit flavours and aromas of freshly cut grass and straw on the nose.
Beautifully balanced, incredibly drinkable, with a soft, clean hop character. Pints of Pils all round, please.

items.name: Five Points XPA
items.desc:
A light and tropical extra pale ale with assertive hop bitterness and aromas of mango and passionfruit. Even paler and hoppier than our legendary Five Points Pale, and the 4% ABV makes it extra drinkable, too.
XPA began its life as our collaboration beer for Field Day festival in 2016. Its sessionable ABV and refreshing, zingy bitterness proved a hit post-festival season, and the beer has since joined our core range in can, keg and cask.

items.name: Five Points XPA
items.desc:
NEW! EXPERIENCE DRAUGHT XPA AT HOME!
A light and tropical extra pale ale with assertive hop bitterness and aromas of mango and passionfruit. Even paler and hoppier than our legendary Five Points Pale, and the 4% ABV makes it extra drinkable, too.
XPA began its life as our collaboration beer for Field Day festival in 2016. Its sessionable ABV and refreshing, zingy bitterness proved a hit post-festival season, and the beer has since joined our core range in can, keg and cask.

items.name: Railway Porter
items.desc:
One of our very first beers with a recipe essentially unchanged ever since the first brew.
A classic, robust London style porter – with our own twist. Smooth and full-bodied, bursting with aromas of dark, bitter chocolate, and roasted coffee. Brewed with 100% British ingredients, East Kent Goldings Hops and an array of seven different malts.
While in stock and enjoyed throughout the year, it’s in the colder, wintery months when Railway Porter really hits the spot. Grab a pint, sit back, and enjoy.

items.name: Basecamp
items.desc:
Foothills, woodland, camp or climb. Strap a pack across your back, explore new places without a map. Find new ways to leave the ground, pitch a tent as the sun goes down. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Basecamp is crisp, dry and refreshing with a floral, spicy aroma.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Carnival Coconut & Lime Sour
items.desc:
Creamy and refreshingly tart, Carnival is a celebration of tropical flavours. Five unique malts add body, with oats providing a creamy mouthfeel. The coconut provides a slight sweetness, with 48 hours of kettle souring and 3kg of lime zest delivering a fresh, tangy finish.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Oats, Lactose, Lime Zest, Natural Coconut Flavour, Natural Almond Flavour, Yeast

items.name: Castaway Mai Tai DIPA
items.desc:
Waves of tropical fruits and citrus set the tone for a hop-forward Double IPA with an island paradise slant. Oats bring a creamy softness, which are layered with natural flavours of orange, almond and lime, and just a little brown sugar to truly reflect the tiki bar classic, the Mai Tai. Pace yourself and savour, you’re on island time now.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Oats, Hops, Maltodextrin, Sugar, Yeast, Natural Flavourings (Almond, Orange, Lime)

items.name: Cosmic Café Coffee Sour
items.desc:
Our sour take on cold press in a can. Lightly roasted malts provide a clean base upon which we’ve added fruity US hops, with some light dry hopping. The addition of Coffee in fermentation and dry hop gives Cosmic Café’ a balanced, roasted bitterness. We kettle soured the wort to add some zing and the result is a smooth, lightly tart sour with a fresh coffee backbone.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Wheat, Coffee, Hops, Yeast

items.name: Deucebox
items.desc:
The oranges for Deucebox, our 8.3% citrus double IPA, are harvested by blasting California Dreaming through very large speakers at such a high intensity, the fruit just falls from the trees and juices itself. This is then added to our lovely citrus IPA recipe with twice the hops, twice the malt and twice the juice to serve up a punchy, tropical, glass of joy, every time.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Easy Peeler
items.desc:
Beach bar, hammock, surf or bike. Roll your trousers to your knees, embrace the sun that breaks the trees. Walk in the rain in a grey raincoat, sit on the sand and watch boats float. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Prominent tangerine and citrus flavours, low bitterness and refreshing finish.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Hemisphere
items.desc:
Forest, foothills, hike or fly. Peaceful days on sunny trails, crazy nights under city lights. Dig for treasure under the moon, search the horizon by hot air balloon. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Vibrant tropical flavours, a gentle bitterness and clean, hoppy finish.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Jazz Age Espresso Martini Stout
items.desc:
Rich, indulgent and creamy, just like the cocktail it’s based on, Jazz Age offers a bold malt profile, full body and plenty of chocolate and coffee. The creaminess comes from six different malts, the joy comes from imagining yourself in a speakeasy in New Orleans with every sip. Settle in, sling on some tunes and enjoy immediately. Or let it warm a little from the fridge, you’ll thank us.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Lactose, Wheat, Hops, Coffee, Yeast

items.name: Juicebox
items.desc:
Mountain, waterfall, hike or climb. Meet fond friends in far-flung bars, share well-worn stories about long-healed scars. Climb over boulders, traverse round bends, stand on a peak looking at the worlds end. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Fresh orange zest, flavours of mango and papaya, the aroma of good times.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Juicebox
items.desc:
Gets pints in your home with this metal 5L minikeg. When you can't go to the pub, make the pub come to you.
Contains Juicebox: Fresh orange zest, flavours of mango and papaya, the aroma of good times.
Comes with a free pint Glass.
Once open the keg will keep for 2/3 days and we put a 2 week best before from the date of filling. The keg coimes with an integral tap for pouring.

items.name: Lantern Earl Grey Session IPA
items.desc:
Lantern focuses on the fusion between full, oriental Earl Grey tea with the vibrant hop profile delivered by four unique American hop varieties. The base is a super juicy, tropical session beer, we then infused the beer with fresh orange and lemon zest, finally, we added the tea for a hint of bergamot and full-bodied black tea.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Oats, Earl Grey Tea, Hops, Yeast

items.name: Last Train
items.desc:
Monuments, markets, stroll or stride. Short days and dark nights, city streets under festive lights. Narrow spaces that you can roam, Leaving London on the last train home. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Last train offers flavours of rich dark chocolate and roasted coffee.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Midsummer Pinot Noir Gose
items.desc:
In collaboration with Noita Winery.
We were determined to create a beer that could bridge the decision between white, rosé or beer on those warm summer evenings. Midsummer offers a light to medium body with a soft malt base and light hop profile. The addition of Pinot Noir grapes from Noita Winery in Finland means there’s plenty of fruit, with blackcurrant and strawberry delivering a jammy sweetness to balance the refreshing salt profile.
Ingredients: Water, Barley, Grape Juice, Wheat, Hops, Yeast

items.name: Monsoon
items.desc:
Gets pints in your home with this metal 5L minikeg. When you can't go to the pub, make the pub come to you.
Contains Monsoon:Fourpure Monsoon is our fresh, local, brewery-direct Pale Ale with a full flavour and a light natural haze. We use a malt and wheat blend to give the beer extra body and texture, six varieties of American hops impart intense, juicy notes of passionfruit, mango, grapefruit, peach, orange, lemon and a little pine.
Comes with a free pint Glass.
Once open the keg will keep for 2/3 days and we put a 2 week best before from the date of filling. The keg coimes with an integral tap for pouring.

items.name: Shapeshifter IPA
items.desc:
Island, inland, canoe or swim. Busy days in city haze, crystal clear water in a tree-lined bay. Stand in the snow and watch snowflakes, row deep lakes to catch great snakes. Choose your adventure, drink good beer. Hop-forward mango and grapefruit deliver intense, tropical flavours.
This beer is suitable for vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Baller
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Baller.
An IPA. We took everything we’ve learnt about making IPAs and put it into this beer. Lots of hops, big bright flavours, smooth body. It’s our go-to IPA.
Goes well with big livin and splashing out.
This is Charlie. He’s a Gipsy Hill co-founder. He likes city life and fast pedalling.

items.name: Bandit
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Bandit.
A Gluten Free Pale Ale. We took our beloved Beatnik and stole the gluten out. It’s a light, refreshing pale. Still fruity, still floral. Loads of flavour, just gluten free.
Goes well with high revs and breeze in your hair.
This is Sam. He’s a Gipsy Hill co-founder. He likes long and windy roads.

items.name: Blisco Dash
items.desc:
This is a single 440ml can of Blisco Dash – A Kveik Pale Ale.
Our favourite Voss yeast strain has been cranking esters through ramped fermentation and cast out temps.
On top of that it’s been loaded with classic Cascade and Hallertau Blanc & Melon hotside for full on pine, floral and sweet-fruit top notes, before being blasted with Idaho 7 in the dry-hop for that tropical kick.
Goes well with getting lost and sweet fresh air.
Featuring Sarah, Gipsy Hill’s finance guru and speed demon.

items.name: Buy The NHS A Pint: West Coast IPA
items.desc:
To support our NHS heroes on the frontlines of the fight against Coronavirus, we started a pay-it-forward scheme to raise money for NHS workers to enjoy well-earned drink. All money raised will be put on as a bar tab redeemable by NHS staff after lockdown. By buying this beer, you’re supporting the cause. See www.buytheNHSapint.com for more details.
This is a 440ml can of our West Coast-style IPA. It’s hopped up with Amarillo, Simcoe and some big C hops (Cascade, Centennial and Columbus) for maximum old school IPA (bitter, resinous and piney), mixed with modern notes (softer, fruity and delicate).

items.name: Buy the NHS a pint!
items.desc:
Buy the NHS a pint!
The pandemic on our doorstep has forced us all into lockdown and thrust our NHS onto the front-line.
As small, independent brewing businesses, we don’t have an abundance of PPE or raw materials to donate, and feel we can’t do much to help except keep providing beers to all of you.
With that in mind though, we landed on a simple idea: With your help, we can get a drink into the hands of someone who’s really earned it – our NHS staff. If you buy the NHS a “pint” on any participating brewery’s web-shop, we’ll make sure that a drink gets into the hands of a well deserving NHS worker once we come off lockdown. They are true heroes and deserve to be rewarded once this crisis has passed. It’s a Pay it Forward scheme that will benefit small business as well as those that deserve our thanks.
A small group of breweries have got together to try and geographically represent the country so you can give to the area you most want to support NHS staff in a post-pandemic world: Fyne Ales (Scotland), Wylam (North East), Cloudwater (North West), North Brewing Co (Yorkshire), Verdant, and Left Handed Giant (South West), Deya (West Midlands), Duration (East Anglia), Gipsy Hill (South East) and Boundary (Northern Ireland).
Each “Buy the NHS a Pint” bought on any of our web-shops will be forwarded to our taprooms. As soon as we’re open again anyone from the NHS and by extension any volunteer signed up to help, can pop in, show their ID and redeem their drink.⁠

items.name: Carver
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Carver.
A Micro IPA. We took everything we love about IPAs and brought down the ABV. It’s hoppy, it’s got body, it’s got balance, tropical aromas and a smooth, juicy taste.
Goes well with bright mornings and open roads.
This is Alice. She’s our Sales Whizz. She likes far-flung adventures.

This pack contains 24 x 330ml cans from our core range.
Each pack includes:

items.name: DJ BBQ Box
items.desc:
This is a 12 pack of 330ml cans and 1 x Burger Book.
A perfect box for an evening cooking over the grill. DJ BBQ is the king of the coals and starting parties. He’s picked two of his favourite Gipsy Hill tinnies – Hepcat and Hunter, and signed 24 copies of his incredible Burger Book.
Go check him out on Instagram for the live cooking, lessons and sweet beats.
Case contents listed below.

items.name: Hepcat
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Hepcat.
A Session IPA. Our mainstay and our original. It’s everything the style should be – fruity nose, juicy body, bright taste. Can we humbly call it a classic?
Goes well with dancefloors and smooth moves.
This is Marcus. He’s our designer, illustrator and friend. He likes expensive jackets and colouring in.

items.name: Hepcat Case
items.desc:
This is 24 x 330ml cans of Hepcat.
You asked, we listened – a full case of Hepcat.
A Session IPA. Our mainstay and our original. It’s everything the style should be – fruity nose, juicy body, bright taste. Can we humbly call it a classic?
Goes well with dancefloors and smooth moves.

items.name: Hitcher
items.desc:
This is a single 440ml can of Hitcher – An American Pale Ale
A clean grist and a classic yeast means this beer harks back to what most of us fell in love with the first time.
A big whirlpool dose of Simcoe and Amarillo, with Simco cyro and Amarillo in the dry hop, gives you dank pine and sweet tangerine.
Goes well with yellows, oranges, reds and purples.
Featuring Ciaran, our production chief and cycling savant.

items.name: Hunter
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Hunter.
An uncompromised lager. All premium malts. All noble hops. Conditioned for 40 days. Unfiltered. Light bitterness, spicy, bready and moreish.
Goes well with swells and big breaks.
This is Simon. Our Head Brewer. He likes beaches and wild, windy days.

items.name: Left Handed Giant: Making Planets DIPA
items.desc: DIPA brewed with Voss Kveik, Columbus, Citra, Cascade and Sabro.

items.name: Left Handed Giant: Opening Theme IPA
items.desc: Galaxy and Nelson Sauvin lend a soft fruit foundation to this IPA.

items.name: Outdoorsman
items.desc:
This is a single 440ml of Outdoorsman – A Triple Fruited Sour.
A classic Gipsy Hill sour base beer, with lashings of blueberry and just a hint of banana thrown in. It’s balanced and sweet, with so much fruity flavour that it must count as one of your five a day (It probably doesn’t).
Goes well with narrow, winding country lanes.
Featuring Terry, Gipsy Hill salesman and South London legend.

items.name: Ranger
items.desc:
This is a single 330ml can of Ranger.
A Pale Ale. Best quality malts. Batch selected hops. It’s clean, balanced, and zesty beer with piney, citrus and stone-fruit notes.
Goes well with open space and hearty meals.
This is Josh. He’s a production wunderkid. He likes home comforts and the great outdoors.

Barleypop / Lite Lager / 4 x 440ml / 4.4% ABV

items.name: Curiosity Vendor

items.name: Grisette
items.desc:
Grisette / Farmhouse Pale / 4 x 440ml / 4.4% ABV

items.name: Packets

Packets / Keller Lager / 4 x 440ml / 4.2% ABV

Packets Keller Lager is a new naturtrüb crispy boy with that Keller Instinct: soft in body; full, bready, fresh flavours; and a quenching, moreish mouthfeel. Thirsty just thinking about it.

items.name: Passionfruit Gose
items.desc:
Passionfruit Gose / Fruit Sour / 24 x 440ml / 4.5% ABV
Suitable for vegans.
Tangy, tropical, tart and tasty. A light and snappy Gose-style sour beer, infused with passionfruit.

items.name: Pocket Rocket
items.desc:
Pocket Rocket / Tiny IPA / 4 x 440ml / 2.7% ABV
Suitable for vegans.

items.name: Alf
items.desc: First brewed in collaboration with our friends at Amundsen Brewery, Oslo, Alf is a style hazy IPA ;). Estery Vermont yeast accentuates the stone fruit and tropical fruit character brought by a heavy dry-hop of Mosaic, Enigma and Denali , whilst a protein-heavy grist gives a full, pillowy body.

items.name: Alf
items.desc: First brewed in collaboration with our friends at Amundsen Brewery, Oslo, Alf is a tongue in cheek, hazy pale ;-). Stone and tropical fruit character is brought by a heavy dry-hop of Mosaic, Enigma and Sultana, balanced on a light, drinkable body.

items.name: American Pilsner
items.desc: Crisp, clean and very drinkable with light notes of citrus, pine and a hint of caramel.

items.name: Barley Wine
items.desc:
Barley Wine 2019
One of the 5 beers produced for our first annual bottle release at the new Salford brewery.
Our 2019 Barley Wine gives a rich, intriguing nose and sumptuous palette. Country fruits, rich sugars and nuttiness are what you should expect from the layers of evolving flavours; contributing to the overall depth and complexity.
Best drunk slightly chilled and allowed to warm whilst consuming.
Now in 660ml sharing bottle

items.name: Berimbolo
items.desc: The first in our series of hop-focused cans for 2018, this dry hopped blonde ale features Enigma hops backed up by Amarillo and Mosaic. Tropical, berry and citrus aromas sit on top of a soft base, with the bitterness dialled back.

items.name: Blended Red Ale
items.desc: This blended mixed-fermentation sour red ale was aged in bourbon, rum and red wine barrels and was brewed in collaboration with Zapato Brewery.

items.name: Bright Spot By Earth Station
items.desc: A complex malt body built out of toasted wheat, oats and barley malts balanced by moderate bitterness and tied together with a thread of Bitter Gold and Lemon Drop hops.

items.name: Caramel Vanilla Imperial Milkshake Stout
items.desc: Brewed with our dear friends Brouwerji Kees. A rich and velveteen stout. Brewed with ice cream cones to give a sumptuous milkshake like body. Giving way to hints of molasses and muscovado, followed by echoes of chocolate and liquorice. Balanced with a warm and comforting toffee and caramel booziness.

items.name: Cross Collar
items.desc: This West Coast-style pale ale first brewed in collaboration with, and with hops sourced by Brook House Hops in Herefordshir. Pine resin and grapefruit flavours and aromas are balanced by a biscuity malt body and bitter finish.

items.name: Cubbio Damage
items.desc: First brewed with our friends at ISBF this West Coast IPA features Simcoe hops backed up by Amarillo and Citra, bringing dank orange, papaya and resinous pine, finished with a clean lingering bitterness. The seminal IPA style with a Marble twist.

items.name: Dry Hopped Sour
items.desc: Dry Hopped, mixed fermentation kettle sour. Citra- Melba edition. Zingy. Flavoursome. Refreshing.

items.name: Earl Grey IPA
items.desc: Kees Bubberman (now of Brouwerij Kees) and John de Vries (now of Brouwerij de Molen) joined us originally to brew this smooth and citrusy India Pale Ale, which is fermented with timed additions of Earl Grey tea.

items.name: Lagonda
items.desc: Named after a classic car owned by the boss’s father, Lagonda has been a house beer since 1997. The beer was originally designated an IPA but we feel pale ale better reflects current beer definitions. Pale in colour, the malts provide a sturdy body on which is built a citrus and floral hop character.

items.name: Manchester Bitter
items.desc: Our most traditional core beer is inspired by a Manchester stalwart; a fondly-remembered original. Speciality malt gives the deep golden colour and robust base, balanced by crisp bitterness and a floral, lemony aroma.

items.name: Marble Stout
items.desc: Roasty and robust.It is deep, dark and rich, with layers of malty complexity to be unravelled with each sip.

items.name: Metric (Pint-Ish)
items.desc: Our 3.9% session ale is brewed with an all pale malt bill and then hopped with a blend of New Zealand and US hops. Our benchmark beer promises a burst of zesty aromas, uplifting grapefruit flavours and a subtle lemongrass finish.

items.name: North-South
items.desc: The tenth beer in our 2018 hop-forward series, North-South is a ‘petite IPA’. Lots of Enigma backed by Amarillo, Azacca & Lemon Drop, brings flavours and aromas of soft stone fruit and zesty lemon & orange, whilst wheat and Vienna provide a full, rounded malt base.

items.name: Pint (Metric)
items.desc:
Our 3.9% session ale is brewed with an all pale malt bill and then hopped with a blend of New Zealand and US hops. Our benchmark beer promises a burst of zesty aromas, uplifting grapefruit flavours and a subtle lemongrass finish.
CONTAINS LIVE YEAST, ALLOW NATURAL SETTLING. ONCE VENTED CONSUME WITHIN 3 DAYS. KEEP AS CLOSE TO 8°C

items.name: Sour Blonde Ale
items.desc: This is the first blend from our 'solera' system: a mixed-fermentation sour blonde ale fermented in oak barrels.

items.name: 18.04 Sandy Kerr
items.summary: North Sea Sessions // Burnt Mill // DDH Session IPA
items.desc:
ABV: 4.7% // OG: 1.053 // EBC: 7 // IBU: 20 // 440ML
INGREDIENTS: Malted BARLEY (GLUTEN), OATS (GLUTEN), Maltodextrin, Hops, Yeast
THE FOURTH BEER IN OUR SANDY KERR SERIES CONTINUES WITH THE THEME OF BREWING REFRESHING SESSION IPAS THAT PUNCH WELL ABOVE THEIR WEIGHT.
It also forms the second of two beers brewed in distant collaboration with Burnt Mill, who last month brewed an IPA at their home in Suffolk. For the return we worked with the same hops and yeast, seeking some consistency across the brews whilst also showing the versatility of ingredients and how they present differently through varying alcohol contents and brewing methods. We selected US varieties Mosaic and Azacca, as well as Australian variety Enigma, for the two brews.
We led with Azacca in the whirlpool, where it contributed distinct pine notes and sweet pineapple. We also included it in the dry hop to a lesser extent, letting the other two varieties lead and bring overripe tropical fruit, bubblegum and watermelon to the fore, with a classic dank West Coast character riding underneath. The grist of both beers features malted and flaked oats prominently for the silky mouthfeel they provide, and we used chit malt and maltodextrin to further boost the body of this lower ABV version.

items.name: Enter The Haze
items.desc:
The humble IPA has been on an incredible journey. With it’s origins in England the style quickly took over the world. Initial American attempts to re-create this classic British style with big, bold US hops led the first West Coast IPA’s, over the last decade we’ve seen the style evolve again. Here we combine higher dry hopping with a water profile and yeast that gives stone and tropical fruit flavor and a hazier appearance to the beer. This is one of our favourite styles of beer and we’re proud to have championed it over the years.
Cases contain:
4 x FAITH
4 X STRIDING EDGE
4 X HEATHEN
All for £32!

items.name: Eternal
items.desc:

A product brewed for almost 7,000 years, a quest for perfection that never ends. Citrusy, light and refreshing. To Eternity.
SUITABLE FOR VEGANS

items.desc:
ABV: 4.3% ABV // 440ML

items.name: Keep The Faith
items.desc:
Every Keep The Faith 12 pack sold includes a £3 donation for our For The North Foundation grant fund. The Foundation looks to offer £5000 grants to support vital community projects and causes in the North. Every 3 months, we advocate a different social cause. Currently, we are championing awareness of the LGBTQ+ community in the North, and this grant fund will go towards supporting projects and organisations that help this community.

items.name: Northern Heroes
items.desc:
These are go-to’s. If you were stranded on a desert Island and could only choose three beers. These would be ours. You open a pub and are only allowed three beers on draft. These are the ones. You’re having the ultimate barbecue, you open the lid of your cooler to find three beers amongst the ice… You get the idea.
Each case contains:
4 x FAITH 330ml
4 X ETERNAL 330ml
4 X NEW WORLD 330ml
All for £25.50!

items.name: Ofs 005
items.desc:
7.0% ABV // 1.068 OG // 7 EBC // 18 IBU // 440ML
INGREDIENTS: Water, Malted BARLEY (GLUTEN), Malted WHEAT (GLUTEN), OATS (GLUTEN), Dextrose, Hops, Yeast
We were given the opportunity to trial some ‘Incognito’ hops, which are basically hops in liquid form. As such, they should give us the ability to crop more out of our kettle at the Old Flax Store. This experimental beer saw us trial whether Incognito hops are a true representation of the real thing, and if they do result in an increase in yield. This beer is hopped with Incognito Citra in the whirlpool, and is dry hopped with Citra T90, Citra BBC, Mosaic and Bru-1 for a big pineapple punch.
----
In 2014 we opened the doors to the Old Flax Store, a Grade II listed building that we found and renovated into the home of Northern Monk.
We grew significantly in the years to follow, but the Old Flax Store remains the heart of the operation. If you’ve ever visited us here, you’ll know that you can look through the ground floor window to see our original tanks still in operation. This is where we brew our smaller, more limited releases.
2020 marks the year that we launch a brand-new beer series, a series dedicated to the exploratory, small-batch nature of brewing at OFS. We’ve released beers exclusive to the Old Flax Store before, but we’ve given this series a whole new identity.
The Old Flax Store Special series will push the boundaries of our brewing, allowing us to be completely experimental in approach. Since these beers will be limited in quantity, we’ve restricted can sales to two per person, to ensure that as many people as possible have the opportunity to try them.
We don’t expect these beers to hang around for long, so be quick if a release catches your eye. Follow our social media channels to make sure that you don’t miss out on a launch.

items.name: Origin
items.desc:
ABV: 5.7% ABV // 11.00 EBC // 45 IBU // 1.05 OG // 330ML

A homage to the origins of IPA and the evolution of this style. Piney, juicy and crisp, Gluten-free and Vegan. The evolution of tradition.
SUITABLE FOR VEGANS

items.name: Retro Faith
items.desc:
5.4% ABV // 6 EBC // 30 IBU // 440ML
INGREDIENTS: Malted BARLEY (GLUTEN), WHEAT, OATS (GLUTEN), Hops, Yeast
We’re in the process of re-jigging our warehouse and took a long look at the stacks of unfilled 2017 branded Faith cans we’ve homed for the past few years.
As a business, we strive to maintain a proactive environmental conscience. Recycling where possible, using sustainable materials and championing local suppliers. We’re not ones to waste resources, so the answer was obvious.
Still fresh just in retro cans.

A Light IPA inspired by one of the North’s highest peaks. Piney, citrusy and fresh. For the believers.
SUITABLE FOR VEGANS

items.name: Beer Gift Pack with surprise compartments
items.summary: A mystery box of beers for that special person in your life.
items.desc: Our beer mixed gift box are a perfect treat for someone you love - or yourself! Exact contents may vary, but we’ll make sure you get to try a great range of our beers and a great glass to drink them with! There will be a mix of bottled ale and canned craft beer, hand picked by the brewery team. You can also decide if you would like cider included in your selection. They're shipped in our mail-order boxes with a perforated numbered cover - just a bit of fun! It's designed to be opened over 12 days - but we won't be upset if all of the numbers are opened at once! This makes a perfect gift for the beer lover in your life and for £50, the price include shipping! These beers may contain barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Breakfast In Luxembourg
items.desc: The latest in our range of seasonal brews, this Espresso Stout is a collaboration with Bare Brewing from Luxembourg, inspired by their own fantastic Espresso Stout we drank whilst at the Metz Beer Fest in October 2019. Coffee roasted locally by Rising Ground in Wadebridge. As with all our seasonal cans, the artwork is provided by the talented students from Falmouth University, combining great beer with great art. This beer is suitable for vegans. Contains barley, wheat and caffeine.

items.name: Breakfast in Luxembourg
items.desc: The latest in our range of seasonal brews, this Espresso Stout is a collaboration with Bare Brewing from Luxembourg, inspired by their own fantastic Espresso Stout we drank whilst at the Metz Beer Fest in October 2019. Coffee obtained locally from Rising Ground in Wadebridge. This beer is suitable for vegans. Contains barley, wheat and caffeine.

items.name: Connor’s Stout
items.desc: Connor's Stout is our Brew 500, so it had to be something special. Imperial Smoked Stout - 11% Each can features artwork by the Connor Brothers. Funds raised for CALM. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Elderflower Sunrise
items.desc: Elderflower Sunrise is a lightly sparkling apple cider with a clean, crisp, dry apple flavour. It is made with selected West Country apples which are pressed and fermented, then infused with elderflower to create a unique refreshing cider with a balanced tart finish. This cider is suitable for vegans and gluten free.

items.name: Mixed Beer Case
items.desc: Get a 6 beer mystery selection of Padstow Brewing Co. beers handpicked by the brewery. These beers are all suitable for vegetarians. Please specify if you want beers all suitable for vegans. They contain barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten. Please note: Mixed cases are sent in our usual, robust, courier safe packaging. The image is for graphic purposes only.

items.name: Moselle Skies
items.desc: Moselle Skies is one of the latest of our seasonal brews, this Brut IPA is a collaboration with Brasserie Bon Poison from Metz in France. Featuring a double dry hop, it combines big floral flavours with a clean and dry finish. As with all our seasonal cans, the artwork is provided by the talented students from Falmouth University, combining great beer with great art. Contains barley and wheat. This beer is suitable for vegans.

items.name: Moselle Skies
items.desc: The latest in our range of seasonal brews, this Brut IPA is a collaboration with Brasserie Bon Poison from Metz in France., inspired by their innovative approach to beer and our previous, well received Brut IPA Cold Skies. This beer is suitable for vegans. Contains barley, and wheat.

items.name: Padstow IPA
items.desc: An English IPA with a traditionally strong ABV. Careful hopping means it’s refreshing, satisfying and rather moreish. Goes well with: Strong, spicy food (great with curry); bold, sweet desserts like carrot cake; mild cheeses such as mild cheddar or mild blue. This is our best selling bottled beer and has won CAMRA Gold and Taste of the West Gold. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, but has had the gluten removed to <20ppm, and so is now labelled as Gluten Free. ** Also available in 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow IPA
items.desc: Our Padstow IPA has a traditionally strong ABV. Careful hopping means it’s refreshing, satisfying and rather moreish. Goes well with: spicy food (perfect with curry), sweet desserts, or mature cheddar and mild blue cheese. This is our best selling bottled beer and has won CAMRA Gold and Taste of the West Gold. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Local
items.desc: Available for the first time ever in minikeg, our 4% Best Bitter, Padstow Local, is not to be missed. Inspired by some of our favourite beers from around the country, Local is a deep golden ale, with a rich malty character.

items.name: Padstow May Day
items.desc: May Day is the most important day of the year for us in Padstow, and we originally created this beer specifically to celebrate it. Due to it's overwhelming popularity, we eventually made it a core beer so we could continue to brew it year-round. Made with extra pale malt and 100% citra hops it has a tropical and slightly bitter flavour with a citrus and elderflower aroma. A crisp, smooth and refreshing pint. Goes well with: Spicy Spanish and Italian meats, spicy paella, pizza and pasta dishes. This beer has been awarded SIBA Gold and Taste of the West Silver. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, but has had the gluten removed to <20ppm, and so is now labelled as Gluten Free. ** Also available in 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow May Day
items.desc: Brewed to celebrate May Day – the most important day of the year in Padstow, this beer has now been added to our core range due to its year-round popularity. Made with extra pale malt and 100% citra hops; it has a tropical flavour with a citrus and elderflower aroma. A crisp, smooth and refreshing pint. Goes well with: spicy Spanish and Italian meats, paella, pizza and pasta. May Day has been awarded SIBA Gold and Taste of the West Silver. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Pale Ale
items.desc: Noticeably hopped with a good balanced bitterness and a refreshing aroma. Still manages to pack a punch for a low ABV beer by the mix of English and American hops added at the steeping stage. Goes well with: meat pies and mild cheddar. Also great with a beef or chicken burger. Our Pale Ale has won Taste of the West Silver and SIBA Bronze. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten. ** Also available in 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow Pale Ale
items.desc: A beautifully light golden ale, Padstow Pale Ale is noticeably hopped with a good balanced bitterness and a refreshing aroma provided by US hops added at the steeping stage. Goes well with: meat pies and mild cheddar. Also great with a beef or chicken burger. Our Pale Ale has won Taste of the West Silver and SIBA Bronze. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Pilot
items.desc: Padstow Pilot is our SIBA National Gold winning Cornish Porter, now available for the first time in minikeg. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Pilsner
items.desc: Padstow Pilsner is made in the traditional way using only the best lager malt and Saaz hops. The beer is carefully fermented at low temperatures to deliver a clean, crisp and refreshing drink. Our pilsner won Best Beer at the Great British Food Awards 2018 and Taste of the West Gold. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, but has had the gluten removed to <20ppm, and so is now labelled as Gluten Free. ** Also available in a 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow Pilsner
items.desc: Our Pilsner is made in the traditional way using the best Extra Pale malt, Saaz hops and lager yeast. The beer is fermented at lower temperatures to preserve flavour. The result is a clean, crisp and refreshing drink. Padstow Pilsner won Best Beer at the Great British Food Awards 2018 and Taste of the West Gold. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Pride
items.desc: Our amber bitter has a wonderful balance between malt and hops, with a smooth, rounded finish thanks to a touch of Cornish honey in the brew. Goes well with: chocolate, malty breads, and caramel. Perfect with a rich and indulgent dessert. Padstow Pride has won Taste of the West Silver. This mini keg contains 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegetarians. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Padstow Sunshine Cider
items.desc: Now back in pint-sized bottles for the first time since 2017! This unique Normandy-style Cornish cider was developed by wine and cider maker John Coulson of Polgoon Vineyard in collaboration with Caron Archer (Head Brewer at Padstow Brewing Co.). Our Sunshine Cider contains pressed English Dessert and Bramley Apples, then fermented using the finest Champagne yeast. The result is a crisp, mouth-watering cider that leaves a satisfyingly long finish. Goes well with: Pork belly and scallops. Perfect with a gammon joint and some crackling. This cider is suitable for vegans and is gluten free. ** A 5% version of this cider is available in 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow Windjammer
items.desc: Padstow Windjammer was originally brewed as a one off seasonal autumn brew with specialised malt to achieve its distinctive copper colour. It has since become our most popular draught ale. A malt-driven traditional English ale with a smooth nutty finish and a subtle spiced fruit aroma. Goes well with: roast chicken or pork, fish & chips, and mild cheese. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, but has had the gluten removed to <20ppm, and so is now labelled as Gluten Free. ** Also available in 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Padstow Windjammer
items.desc: Padstow Windjammer was originally brewed as a one off seasonal autumn brew with specialised malt to achieve its distinctive copper colour. It has since become our most popular draught ale. A malt-driven traditional English ale with a smooth nutty finish and subtle spiced fruit aroma. Goes well with: roast chicken or pork, fish & chips, mild cheeses. This mini keg holds 5 litres (8.8 pints). Directions for use are printed on the container. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Pocket Rocket
items.desc: It's back! Pocket Rocket is an American style Pale Ale, brewed with vibrant U.S hop varieties and dry hopped to add even more flavour and aroma. Unfiltered, unpasteurised and unfined for maximum freshness! This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, but has had the gluten removed to <20ppm, and so is now labelled as Gluten Free.

items.name: Pocket Rocket
items.desc: Now in minikeg, Pocket Rocket is the perfect hop-forward session IPA. Plenty of hoppy character, a solid malt backbone and at 4% ideal for a barbecue, afternoon in the garden or quiet evening drink.

items.name: Red Sky
items.desc: Red Sky is a brilliant dark red berry fruit cider. It is made from selected West Country apples and summer orchard fruits, these are pressed and fermented to produce a light, crisp and refreshing Cornish Cider. It has a long finish of delicious, sweet red berry fruits. This cider is suitable for vegans.

items.name: Shallow End
items.desc: Shallow End is the latest incarnation of our hugely popular 2.8% Shallow series. Now with additional oats for more body whilst retaining the low bitterness, delicate hop aroma and big bold flavour of its predecessors, we are sure you will agree this is the best Shallow End yet. With phenomenal artwork by Falmouth Student, Esmé Fergusson (@Esmefineart), we are hugely proud of this product, combining great beer with great art. This beer is unfined and suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Spiced Vintage Ale
items.desc: To create our Spiced Vintage Ale, we took our award-winning winter porter, 317, infused it with additional fruit and spices and aged it in an oak barrel for six months. Hand bottled, hand labelled. Individually numbered and signed by our brewer. Low-carbonation to enhance the sipping characteristics. Two years in the making. A truly unique product. This beer is suitable for vegetarians. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Sundowner 3.0
items.desc: Sundowner 3.0 is the long awaited follow up to the SIBA National Gold winning Sundowner 2.0. We've added oats for more body, and kept the massive double dry hop (DDH) with just a few adjustments to maximise the flavour. Smooth and punchy this is our best NEIPA (New England IPA) yet. Continuing our work with Falmouth University combining great beer with great art, this can features the work of Esmé Fergusson (@Esmefineart) This beer is unfined and suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat,which are sources of gluten.

items.name: Sunlight Cider
items.desc: Available for the first time ever in minikeg, our 5% Sunlight Cider is perfect for those warm days in the garden, on the balcony or even in the kitchen! Based on our hugely popular Sunshine Cider, this is a more sessionable 5% whilst retaining the same great flavour. This product is Gluten Free and suitable for both vegetarians and vegans.

items.name: Support the Fishermen’s Mission
items.desc: Brewed in support of the Fishermen's Mission, 1881 commemorates the year of their founding and helps to raise money towards their vital work in the present. Find out more at https://www.fishermensmission.org.uk/ A pale, refreshing, unfiltered lager, 1881 has been patiently fermented and packaged to maximise its clean flavour. This can continues our relationship with Falmouth University and features the wonderful artwork of Esme Fergusson @esmefineart This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley, wheat and oats. ** Also available in a 5 litre mini-keg **

items.name: Support the Fishermen’s Mission
items.desc: Brewed in support of the Fishermen's Mission, 1881 commemorates the year of their founding and helps to raise money towards their vital work in the present. Find out more at https://www.fishermensmission.org.uk/ A pale, refreshing, unfiltered lager, 1881 has been patiently fermented and packaged to maximise its clean flavour. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley, wheat and oats. ** Also available in 440ml cans **

items.name: The Smoke
items.desc: Made with seven different malts, including beech-smoked malt and rolled oats, this stout is rich, smooth and malty with a subtle smokey aftertaste. Winner of the SIBA British Dark Beers 2019 National Gold award. This beer is suitable for vegans. It contains barley and wheat, which are sources of gluten.

A SUPERBLY DRINKABLE CARAMEL LAGER BREWED OVER SIX MONTHS AND THEN FROZEN IN TANK FOR A CLEAN DRINKING EXPERIENCE
STYLE: EISBOCK
ABV: 8.0%

STYLE: SESSION IPL & HELLES
ABV: 4.5% & 4.8%

items.desc:
THE WORLDS MOST POPULAR BEER STYLE IS GIVEN THE PILLARS TREATMENT. 4%, GLUTEN-FREE AND VEGAN-FRIENDLY. THIS IS A PILSNER FOR THE PEOPLE.
STYLE: PILSNER
ABV: 4.0%
Pillars Pilsner keg (5 litres - just under 9 pints of beer)

items.name: Pillars Tropical Pilsner
items.desc:
SUMMER BEER IS HERE AND IT'S TOTALLY TROPICAL, MAN! OUR BEST SELLING PILLARS PILSNER WITH A WITH A MOUTH-WATERING FRUITY TWIST. MEET TROPICAL PILSNER! INFUSED WITH GUAVA, PINEAPPLE, MANGO AND LYCHEE. PERFECT FOR BBQS AND GARDEN GARDEN CHILL TIMES.
STYLE: PILSNER
ABV: 4.0%
Pillars Tropical Pilsner keg (5 litres - just under 9 pints of beer)

items.desc:
AWARD WINNING MODERN LAGER WITH A RIOT OF GOLDEN, FULL-BODIED FLAVOUR
STYLE: HELLES LAGER
ABV: 4.8%

items.name: Untraditional Lager
items.desc:
A HOPPY LAGER WITH FLAVOURS OF APRICOT, PASSION FRUIT AND CITRUS. CLEAN, CRISP AND REFRESHING
STYLE: SESSION IPL
ABV: 4.5%

items.name: Behind Door Number 3
items.desc:
8.5% Mosaic & Citra New England DIPA 440ml Can
Behind Door Number 3 is the culmination of lots of experimentation pushing fruity and juicy hops to the maximum.
Big hitter hops + London Fog yeast = a beer worth waiting all year for.

items.name: Circuits
items.desc:
7.2% Citra & Ekuanot NEIPA 440ml Can
Connect to the mainframe, it's a wild ride.
Citra & Ekuanot are dreamy hops that we love to play with, used here in a hazy NEIPA for maximum fun times!

items.name: Dreamlife
items.desc:
New England Pale 4.6%
Lie down in the green grass, look up into the blue skies and contemplate life, dreams and everything in between. Dreamlife is a soft & hazy pale ale, made for easy drinking and easy dreaming.
Made with hops from all corners of the globe, it’s a sessionable New England pale ale brewed with Nelson Sauvin from New Zealand, Amarillo from the U.S. and Mandarina Bavaria from Germany.
It has distinct citrus notes of orange and grapefruit imparted by the Amarillo and Manadarina hops, while the Huell Melon  gives the beer a green fruit & melon aroma which carries through into the palate.
Dream a little dream of Dreamlife.
Label artwork by Pressure Drop's own Sienna O'Rourke

items.name: Future Sunshine
items.desc:
6.5 % Peach, Pineapple & Passionfruit Sour 440ml CAN
(contains lactose- not suitable for vegans)
How much fruit can you jam in one beer?
A whole heckin' lot it turns out!
Future Sunshine tastes just like it you'd imagine, sweet and sour with a creamy body (thank you lactose).
Cheer up juice in a can.
SHIPPING £5.99 per box
Boxes hold up to 15 cans
Our minimum order is 8 cans (these can be a mix of different beers)

items.name: Great Heights
items.desc:
4.8% Unfiltered Pilsner
A brewer’s life is a busy one. It’s not always easy to get a break. However, sometimes a break can result in some great brewing.
Great Heights is a pilsner that is lagered in tank for six weeks, to achieve maximum crispy freshness. Mittelfruh & Perle hops for a classic light bitterness, Great Heights is an uncomplicated delight. A great pilsner is a true and simple joy, and aren’t those the best kind of joys you can have?
The dreamy artwork on this label is by Tottenham based artist Natsko Seki

items.name: It Is Wednesday My Dudes
items.desc:
5.2% Special Lager
A Vienna style lager brings fresh and floral hops together with a blend of toasty German malts. Crisp & refreshing but with a rich and complex flavour, perfect for a summertime BBQ.

items.name: Pale Fire
items.desc:
4.8% Amarillo & Mosaic Pale Ale 440ml Can
Pale Fire.
We’ve come a long long way together.
If there is one beer that we think of when our minds drift to what Pressure Drop means, it is Pale Fire. Brewed every week since our earliest days, it is our shining, hazy gold, North Star of a beer.
Pale Fire is the definition of the Pressure Drop mantra - “We brew what we would like to drink”. Sessionable, with tropical aromas from the Mosaic and Amarillo hops, it is a juicy pale with a balanced bitter finish.
When we first began experimenting with canning here at Pressure Drop, the end goal was always going to be Pale Fire in cans. Spending time with pals, opening a six pack of fresh and crisp Pale Fire, enjoying its easy drinking ways. That has been the dream, now it is the reality.
Find your nearest sun drenched swimming pool, hike in the gentle shade of a pine forest, or, failing that, sit in the hazy summer heat of a city park. Crack open a can, and let the world become a better place.
Label Artwork by our Graham O'Brien
SHIPPING £5.99 per box
Boxes hold up to 15 cans
Our minimum order is 12 cans (these can be a mix of different beers)

items.name: The Rendezvous
items.desc:
6.8% Idaho 7 & Bru-1 NEIPA 440ml Can
We went with some of our favourite new hops, Bru-1 & Idaho 7, along with London Fog, our preferred yeast for New England styles. The result takes our usual hazy pales and turns the volume up. Play it loud.
The label art, designed by Sienna, is inspired by The Memphis group. Keeping it simple and a little bit fun all at the same time - we contain multitudes!

items.name: Tomorrow's World
items.desc:
New England Pale 5.5% 440ml CAN
Assemble your finest hops and let's hit the road. We're heading to the future, baby!
Don't need no ticket for this journey...
Where we're going there are no roads....
It's a brave new world out there!
Better buckle up!
3...2...1...BLAST OFF!
Mosaic, Citra, Simcoe, Amarillo + London Ale 3
soft
hazy
tropical
delicious

items.desc:
This dangerously drinkable Vietnamese coffee stout starts with an assertive roasty bitterness from the dark malts which quickly gives way to a smooth rich dark chocolate and hazelnut finish.
Contains Gluten from Barley

Suitable for Vegans

items.desc:

Gluten from barley and oats

items.name: Perceptionless
items.desc:

Unfined, Unfiltered and Vegan Friendly.

items.name: Pilsner Hersbrucker
items.desc:
Inspired by the Oktoberfest event at our bar we wanted to brew an unfiltered pure flavourful craft lager. Using German Hersbrucker hops, pilsner malt and yeast. This beer has a lovely balance of bitter and sweet with long soft toasty finish.
Contains gluten from barley
Suitable for Vegans

items.name: Saison
items.desc:
An easy drinking and refreshing golden saison made with Pilsner malt, malted and un-malted wheat, lightly hopped with Saaz and fermented with a Farmhouse Saison yeast strain. The yeast gives a lovely gentle spice and pear-like fruitiness.
Suitable for vegans

items.name: Saison - Cider Apple Blend
items.desc:
Two years ago we started filling wine barrels with a mixed fermentation Saison. This release is a blend of a 2 year old white Burgundy barrel, fresh Saison and cider made with apples from local orchards. Light and refreshing with a slightly tart finish and a hint of oak.
Suitable for vegans

items.name: Weightless
items.desc:
Made with 100% Mosaic hops; pithy grapefruit and mango flavours with a well-rounded body. An uncompromisingly balanced session IPA.
Contains gluten from barley and wheat

items.name: Witless
items.desc: There is nothing better in the sunshine than an easy drinking and refreshing wheat beer. Coriander in the boil & lemon zest in the fermenter give a crisp and zesty finish.

items.name: Wreckless
items.desc:
Beautifully balanced pale ale loaded with Citra and Amarillo hops providing massive amounts of tropical fruit with a clean finish.
AWARDS
GOLD - SIBA NW Region / SILVER -SIBA Nationals 2020 - Keg
GOLD - SIBA NW Region Premium Bitters & Pale Ales 2018

items.name: Bethnal Pale Ale
items.desc:
BETHNAL PALE ALE
5.5% ABV AMERICAN PALE ALE BOTTLE 330ML
Our modern American pale ale. Tropical fruit aroma produced by a big blend of American hops. Citrus zing on the front of the palate followed by passion fruit notes. Medium body with a refreshing bitterness.

items.name: Deck Chair Pale Ale
items.desc:
DECK CHAIR PALE ALE 4.5% ABV BOTTLE 330ML
This lockdown special combines the flavour and aroma of orange blossom with a punchy pale ale to give a fruity and aromatic nectar.

items.name: Great Eastern IPA
items.desc:
GREAT EASTERN IPA
BACK IN STOCK
7.4% ABV AMERICAN IPA BOTTLE 330ML
A true west coast IPA. American hops give a strong orange and citrus fruit flavour coupled with a balanced bitterness.
Hints of grapefruit complete the taste sensation.

items.name: Hoxton Stout
items.desc:
Out of Stock - Back Late Summer
HOXTON STOUT
5% ABV HOPPY STOUT BOTTLE 330ML
Our reinvention of a traditional stout. On the nose, you experience toasted bread, coffee and chocolate.
A blend of punchy American hops gives a fresh, almost fruity flavour with a pleasant kick of bitterness to finish.

items.name: März Ataks
items.desc:
Back in Stock
MARZ ATAKS
5.0% ABV German Märzen Bottle 330ML
This Marzen invades the senses with complex aromas of malt and chestnut honey.
The flavour is layered with sweet biscuit, toasted bread and a hint of bitterness.
Rich copper in colour and bone dry to finish, as though fresh from the surface of the red planet itself.

items.name: Old Ford Export Stout
items.desc:
OLD FORD EXPORT STOUT
7.4% ABV EXPORT STOUT BOTTLE 330ML
A big export stout. Luxurious, complex and velvety bodied beer. Flavours ranging from dried fruit to vanilla and from chocolate to caramel. The strong presence of booze makes it ideal for gastronomic pairings with rich foods.

items.name: Paradise IPA
items.desc:
PARADISE IPA
3.7% ABV SESSION IPA BOTTLE 330ML
A session IPA. The moderate alcohol content is supported by a strong malt base with added oats for a fuller body.
The bouquet is explosive with fresh lime, tropical fruits and citrus making this fresh, easy-drinking and complex in equal measure.

items.name: Redchurch Lager
items.desc:
REDCHURCH LAGER
4.7% ABV NEW WAVE LAGER BOTTLE 330ML
Top seller - Winner World Beer Awards 2019
Our flagship beer & all-round crowd-pleaser. Characteristic hints of British malt with a grassy aroma. German and American hops complement each other and work with the sweetness of the malt base to provide a refreshing,
A clean and exceptionally well-balanced beer

items.name: Shoreditch Blonde
items.desc:
SHOREDITCH BLONDE
4.5% ABV CONTINENTAL STYLE BLONDE BOTTLE 330ML
Our Belgian inspired blonde beer. Saison yeast is the star of the show and pairs with European hops to give a fruit and banana aroma.
Extra pale malt and wheat malt give a sweetness and full body.

items.name: Stort Valley Kölsch
items.desc:
Brand New Special - Release W/C 25th May
STORT VALLEY KOLSCH STYLE ALE
4.5% ABV GERMAN KOLSCH STYLE 330ml BOTTLE
Crisp and refreshing with a well-rounded bitterness and solid pilsner malt base. Subtle sweetness accompanied by aromas of apple, pear and tropical fruits from the use of traditional German hops makes this perfect for a hot summer's day.

items.name: Stratford Pilsner
items.desc:
STRATFORD PILSNER
4% ABV PILSNER BOTTLE 330ML
The traditional German malt base provides a sweet biscuity flavour profile accompanied by the combination of German and British hops to give this classic pilsner a modern British twist. Clean, crisp and refreshing. The traditional German malt base provides a sweet biscuity flavour profile accompanied by the combination of German and British hops to give this classic pilsner a modern British twist. items.name: Urban Farmhouse Barrels 1 &2
items.desc:
BARRELS 1 & 2 SOUR - VINTAGE STOCK RELEASE
5% ABV SOUR BOTTLE 750ML
The original Urban Farmhouse. One of the first batches of Tartelette, hidden away in Chardonnay barrels for 24 months.
The barrels have worked their magic and have imparted their magic and have imparted an unmistakeable vinous character-rich and warming but with great acidity still. A true farmhouse ale on the nose with earthy notes and aromas of sweet hay.
The beer has incredible depth like a good chardonnay, light carbonation and the unmistakable acidity of our house cultures.

items.name: Broken Dream
items.desc:
Broken Dream is deep and complex. She lurks in your imagination. She binds smoke and coffee aromas with chocolate, milk and oats to create something thick, velvety and slick.
A 6.5% breakfast stout with a gentle touch of smoke, coffee and chocolate.

items.name: Calypso
items.desc:
Calypso roars with sharp, spritzy and mouth-puckering sensation, accented by tropical and citrussy hop aroma. It's clean, refreshing and always keeps you going back for more. Our sour showcase rotates the dry-hopping, so each brew offers something different and unique. Check the hops in each batch below:
